page.title: 03WATER SUPPLY - POTT SHRIGLEY
page.content: At present Pott Shrigley receives all its mains water from a borehole about a mile to the east of the village. During the last ten years this source has not always fully met the demand and in periods of drought the service reservoir has run dry. Supplies have had to be supplemented by road tankers on five occasions. Tankers obtained this water from the Adlington borehole system, which was commissioned in 1971 and now supplies Poynton and Adlington. As this is a reliable source of good quality water, North West Water Authority now plan to build a new pumping station at Roundy Lane to extract and raise water for Pott Shrigley permanently. Softening of Adlington water by an ion-exchange process had to be reduced in July under EEC legislation concerning links between soft water and heart disease.
